data.title: Icon, Saints with silver halo (1)
data.meta_description: Auction, in Netherlands: Rare icon - 4 saints - Top middle Christ. Christ and 2 saints with thick silver profile aureoles - also confirmed...
data.text:
[ translate ]

Rare icon - 4 saints - Top middle Christ. Christ and 2 saints with thick silver profile aureoles - also confirmed with silver nails. In any case, one has a silver label crown with a content mark 84 (from 84 Zolotniki =. 875/ . 1000) - The Christ aureole also seems to have a mark (lower right) but difficult to see. Format: 31 x 29 x 2. 5 cm Condition: Bottom left some surface damage as visible - to prevent from crumbling further, this place is stabilised with varnish - the underside of the 2nd Saint on the left side the red mantel tip is (underside) coloured up - at the back some dead wormholes (treated) - otherwise normal signs of age as visible! This lot will be shipped by registered mail with track and trace The Saints from left to right: Macarius of Egypt (Greek: (300-391) was a Coptic Christian monk and hermit - he is also known as Macarius the Elder, Macarius the Great and the Lamp of the Desert. Jude Taddeüs is one of the twelve Apostles of Jesus - 'Taddeüs' means gentle -he must not be confused with another disciple of Jesus, his traitor Judas Iscariot - Sometimes he is identified with Judas, the brother of James the Lesser (and he might be a brother of Jesus) . Solomonia Yuryevna Saburova: (1490 – 18 December 1542) was the first wife of Grand Prince Vasili III of Muscovy - she was canonised by the Russian Orthodox Church as St. Sophia of Suzdal. Sophia of Rome († 304) is a sacred martyr of the Roman Catholic Church - her name day falls on 15 May - Sophia of Rome is sometimes counted among the Glacial Saints - she became the victim of the Christian persecution of Emperor Diocletian in 304 - Sophia is also worshipped in the Oriental churches, where a large number of icons of her are in circulation.

[ translate ]
